CreateBackend.name: CreateBackend
CreateBackend.documentation: This operation creates a backend for an Amplify app. Backends are automatically created at the time of app creation.

CreateBackendConfig.name: CreateBackendConfig
CreateBackendConfig.documentation: Creates a config object for a backend.

CreateToken.name: CreateToken
CreateToken.documentation: Generates a one-time challenge code to authenticate a user into your Amplify Admin UI.

DeleteBackend.name: DeleteBackend
DeleteBackend.documentation: Removes an existing environment from your Amplify project.

DeleteToken.name: DeleteToken
DeleteToken.documentation: Deletes the challenge token based on the given appId and sessionId.

GenerateBackendAPIModels.name: GenerateBackendAPIModels
GenerateBackendAPIModels.documentation: Generates a model schema for an existing backend API resource.

GetBackend.name: GetBackend
GetBackend.documentation: Provides project-level details for your Amplify UI project.

GetBackendAPI.name: GetBackendAPI
GetBackendAPI.documentation: Gets the details for a backend API.

GetBackendAPIModels.name: GetBackendAPIModels
GetBackendAPIModels.documentation: Gets a model introspection schema for an existing backend API resource.

GetBackendStorage.name: GetBackendStorage
GetBackendStorage.documentation: Gets details for a backend storage resource.

GetToken.name: GetToken
GetToken.documentation: Gets the challenge token based on the given appId and sessionId.

ListBackendJobs.name: ListBackendJobs
ListBackendJobs.documentation: Lists the jobs for the backend of an Amplify app.

ListS3Buckets.name: ListS3Buckets
ListS3Buckets.documentation: The list of S3 buckets in your account.

RemoveAllBackends.name: RemoveAllBackends
RemoveAllBackends.documentation: Removes all backend environments from your Amplify project.

RemoveBackendConfig.name: RemoveBackendConfig
RemoveBackendConfig.documentation: Removes the AWS resources required to access the Amplify Admin UI.

UpdateBackendConfig.name: UpdateBackendConfig
UpdateBackendConfig.documentation: Updates the AWS resources required to access the Amplify Admin UI.

CognitoUserPoolId.documentation: The Amazon Cognito user pool ID, if Amazon Cognito was used as an authentication setting to access your data models.

Description.documentation: The API key description for API_KEY, if it was used as an authentication mechanism to access your data models.

ExpirationTime.documentation: The API key expiration time for API_KEY, if it was used as an authentication mechanism to access your data models.

OpenIDAuthTTL.documentation: The expiry time for the OpenID authentication mechanism.

OpenIDClientId.documentation: The clientID for openID, if openID was used as an authentication setting to access your data models.

OpenIDIatTTL.documentation: The expiry time for the OpenID authentication mechanism.

OpenIDIssueURL.documentation: The openID issuer URL, if openID was used as an authentication setting to access your data models.

OpenIDProviderName.documentation: The OpenID provider name, if OpenID was used as an authentication mechanism to access your data models.

BackendAPIAppSyncAuthSettings.documentation: The authentication settings for accessing provisioned data models in your Amplify project.

BackendAPIAuthType.documentation: Describes the auth types for your configured data models.

Error.documentation: If the request fails, this error is returned.

BackendAPICodegenRespObj.documentation: The response object sent when a backend is created.

BackendAPIConflictResolution.documentation: Describes the conflict resolution configuration for your data model configured in your Amplify project.

ResourceConfig.documentation: Defines the resource configuration for the data model in your Amplify project.

AdditionalAuthTypes.documentation: Additional authentication methods used to interact with your data models.

ApiName.documentation: The API name used to interact with the data model, configured as a part of your Amplify project.

ConflictResolution.documentation: The conflict resolution strategy for your data stored in the data models.

DefaultAuthType.documentation: The default authentication type for interacting with the configured data models in your Amplify project.

Service.documentation: The service used to provision and interact with the data model.

TransformSchema.documentation: The definition of the data model in the annotated transform of the GraphQL schema.

BackendAPIResourceConfig.documentation: The resource config for the data model, configured as a part of the Amplify project.

Error.documentation: If the request fails, this error is returned.

BackendAPIRespObj.documentation: The response object sent when a backend is created.

ClientId.documentation: Describes the client_id (also called Services ID) that comes from Apple.

KeyId.documentation: Describes the key_id that comes from Apple.

PrivateKey.documentation: Describes the private_key that comes from Apple.

TeamId.documentation: Describes the team_id that comes from Apple.

BackendAuthAppleProviderConfig.documentation: Describes Apple social federation configurations for allowing your app users to sign in using OAuth.

Error.documentation: If the request fails, this error is returned.

ClientId.documentation: Describes the client_id, which can be obtained from the third-party social federation provider.

ClientSecret.documentation: Describes the client_secret, which can be obtained from third-party social federation providers.

BackendAuthSocialProviderConfig.documentation: Describes third-party social federation configurations for allowing your app users to sign in using OAuth.

BackendManagerAppId.documentation: The app ID for the backend manager.

Error.documentation: If the request fails, this error is returned.

LoginAuthConfig.documentation: Describes the Amazon Cognito configurations for the Admin UI auth resource to log in with.

Status.documentation: Filters the list of response objects to include only those with the specified status.

CreateTime.documentation: The time when the job was created.

UpdateTime.documentation: The time when the job was last updated.

Authenticated.documentation: Lists all authenticated user read, write, and delete permissions for your S3 bucket.

UnAuthenticated.documentation: Lists all unauthenticated user read, write, and delete permissions for your S3 bucket.

BackendStoragePermissions.documentation: Describes the read, write, and delete permissions users have against your storage S3 bucket.

Message.documentation: An error message to inform that the request failed.

BadRequestException.documentation: An error returned if a request is not formed properly.

DeliveryMethod.documentation: (DEPRECATED) Describes which mode to use (either SMS or email) to deliver messages to app users who want to recover their password.

EmailSettings.documentation: (DEPRECATED) The configuration for the email sent when an app user forgets their password.

SmsSettings.documentation: (DEPRECATED) The configuration for the SMS message sent when an app user forgets their password.

CreateBackendAuthForgotPasswordConfig.documentation: (DEPRECATED) Describes the forgot password policy for authenticating into the Amplify app.

IdentityPoolName.documentation: Name of the Amazon Cognito identity pool used for authorization.

UnauthenticatedLogin.documentation: Set to true or false based on whether you want to enable guest authorization to your Amplify app.

CreateBackendAuthIdentityPoolConfig.documentation: Describes authorization configurations for the auth resources, configured as a part of your Amplify project.

MFAMode.documentation: Describes whether MFA should be [ON, OFF, or OPTIONAL] for authentication in your Amplify project.

Settings.documentation: Describes the configuration settings and methods for your Amplify app users to use MFA.

CreateBackendAuthMFAConfig.documentation: Describes whether to apply multi-factor authentication policies for your Amazon Cognito user pool configured as a part of your Amplify project.

DomainPrefix.documentation: The domain prefix for your Amplify app.

OAuthGrantType.documentation: The OAuth grant type that you use to allow app users to authenticate from your Amplify app.

OAuthScopes.documentation: List of OAuth-related flows used to allow your app users to authenticate from your Amplify app.

RedirectSignInURIs.documentation: The redirected URI for signing in to your Amplify app.

RedirectSignOutURIs.documentation: Redirect URLs that OAuth uses when a user signs out of an Amplify app.

SocialProviderSettings.documentation: The settings for using social providers to access your Amplify app.

CreateBackendAuthOAuthConfig.documentation: Creates the OAuth configuration for your Amplify project.

AdditionalConstraints.documentation: Additional constraints for the password used to access the backend of your Amplify project.

MinimumLength.documentation: The minimum length of the password used to access the backend of your Amplify project.

CreateBackendAuthPasswordPolicyConfig.documentation: The password policy configuration for the backend to your Amplify project.
